title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' action, a message appears at the top of the window stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is displayed even when the package name field is empty.
EB: The message should only be displayed if a folder with the same name as the entered package name already exists. If the package name field is empty, no message should be displayed.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Invoke the 'New Java Package' action. 2. Leave the package name field empty. 3. Observe the message at the top of the window.
